history.content: According to Mike from SLC, in terms of content/difficulty, Stat 134 << EE 126, but Stat 134 + Stat 150 >> EE 126

children.subject: I took both. 127 is much much harder because the people in the class are more self-selected, so the curve is tougher.
OP here, even though it might be irrelevant cuz they are different topics, I also have to say 127 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>134
Hey @OP, sort of an irrelevant question, but how would you compare the difficulty of eecs 127 to stat 134? (I know they're totally different classes, but still.)

history.content:
Hi, I am a rising junior majoring cs and stats.

I want to ask which random (stochastic) process course I should take (from Stat 150 and EECS 126)

I have taken Math 54, EECS 127, Stat 134, Stat 135, and CS 188, did pretty well on all of them, and I am planning on taking 189 this fall.

I wonder if Stat 134 + 150 can be a sufficient substitute for EECS 126.

I am also interested in taking grad courses later, so I was wonder if I must take EECS 126, or just take Stat 150 to finish the stat major requirement,

because I have seen a few grad courses instructors who listed EECS 126 as a must-take course.

Also wondering if taking 150 will be a worse option for understanding concepts in EECS grad courses later.

Thank you for your help!
history.subject: Which random (stochastic) process course should I take?
